name: Operation
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation
description:
Operation

A resource represents the long-running, asynchronous processing of a speech-recognition operation. The op can be refreshed to retrieve recognition results once the audio data has been processed.

See Project#process and Audio#process.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> false
op.reload! # API call
op.done? #=> true
results = op.results

methods.name: id
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#id
methods.description: The unique identifier for the long running operation.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.id #=> "1234567890"

returns.description: The unique identifier for the long running operation.

methods.name: done?
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#done?
methods.description: Checks if the speech-recognition processing of the audio data is complete.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> false

methods.name: results
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#results
methods.description: A speech recognition result corresponding to a portion of the audio.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> true
op.results? #=> true
results = op.results

returns.description: The transcribed text of audio recognized. If the op is not done this will return nil.

methods.name: results?
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#results?
methods.description: Checks if the speech-recognition processing of the audio data is complete.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> true
op.results? #=> true
results = op.results

methods.name: error
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#error
methods.description: The error information if the speech-recognition processing of the audio data has returned an error.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> true
op.error? #=> true
error = op.error

methods.name: error?
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#error?
methods.description: Checks if the speech-recognition processing of the audio data has returned an error.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> true
op.error? #=> true
error = op.error

methods.name: reload!
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#reload!
methods.description: Reloads the op with current data from the long-running, asynchronous processing of a speech-recognition operation.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> false
op.reload! # API call
op.done? #=> true

methods.name: wait_until_done!
title: Google
Cloud
Speech
Operation#wait_until_done!
methods.description: Reloads the op until the operation is complete. The delay between reloads will incrementally increase.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/speech"

speech = Google::Cloud::Speech.new

op = speech.process "path/to/audio.raw",
                    encoding: :linear16,
                    language: "en-US",
                    sample_rate: 16000

op.done? #=> false
op.wait_until_done!
op.done? #=> true
